subject: Re: [junit] How to avoid running a test class multiple times
msgSnippet: Ah, thanks for the reminder on that.  We decided to release 4.9 without a full-fledged replacement for Categories, but it should probably go back on the list
messageBody:
Ah, thanks for the reminder on that. We decided to release 4.9
without a full-fledged replacement for Categories, but it should
probably go back on the list for 4.10.

David Saff

On Thu, Jan 27, 2011 at 3:07 PM, John Cortell <john.cortell@...> wrote:
> I set out to give Categories a shot, and ran into issues using them in
> Eclipse/JUnit. Wouldn't you know it...I ran into a post from you in bugzilla
> that knocked the wind out of that sail.
>
> https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=318299
>
> John
>
> On Wed, Jan 26, 2011 at 7:12 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> Not as simply as you might think. Could you achieve what you want
>> with Categories (from 4.8?)
>>
>> David Saff
>>
>>
>> On Wed, Jan 26, 2011 at 5:29 PM, johncortell <john.cortell@...<john.cortell%40gmail.com>>
>> wrote:
>> > Is there a way to tell JUnit to execute a class only once no matter how
>> many times it appears in an invoked test suite?
>> >
>> > E.g., say SomeTestClass.java is included in both test suite 'A'
>> > Â and test suite 'B'. But I have a higher-level suite call 'All' which
>> includes both 'A' and 'B'. Running 'All' will thus run SomeTestClass.java
>> twice. Is there a way to prevent that?
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> > ------------------------------------
>> >
>> > Yahoo! Groups Links
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>>
>>
